result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony D. Hamilton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant 's probation revoked, sentenced to prison on 1-25-21; unpaid supervision fees of $1,532
Sentencing Hearing on Revocation 1-25-2021 filed by Court Reporter Catherine Thimm Braunschweig

9:02 AM Defendant Anthony D. Hamilton appeared, in custody at Fox Lake Correctional Institution, by video Zoom, with attorney Annie E Getsinger by video Zoom.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video Zoom. Advisement of rights. Sentencing recommendations argued. Defendant made a statement. Court sentenced the defendant to serve  years in prison.  Ct. 1: 1 year initial confinement and 1 year extended supervision, concurrent with Ct. 2. Ct. 2 Court ordered 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, consecutive to any other sentence, concurrent with Ct. 1.  A civil judgment will be entered for the unpaid financial obligations. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. No credit.
Letter on behalf of defendant filed by C.R.   Pursuant to the Supreme Court's Order issued 4/13/2020, this document is deemed filed 01/07/2021 because that is the date it was mailed.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 25, 2021 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 22, 2021 at 03:00 pm.

Counsel has received revocation order and warrant, Court reviews defendant's rights to be personally present, Defendant would like to proceed by video Zoom, Defendant states he would like Atty Middleton to withdraw as counsel, Atty Middleton states he can have someone reappointed, Defendant requesting reset, matter to be reset for Sentencing After Revocation in 30 days by Zoom, 3:12 P.M.
